TaxonIdentification.species_name: 西畴薹草 xi chou tai cao

treatment.description: Rhizome ligneous, obliquely ascending. Culms densely tufted, 40–100 cm tall, 1.5–2 mm thick, triquetrous. Leaves slightly shorter than culm, flat, 4–5 mm wide, stiff, scabrous on upper part and margins, abaxial surface cinereous, densely papillate. Involucral bracts green or brown, spathelike, involucral bract blades setaceous. Spikes 4 or 5, rather remote; terminal spike male, cylindric, 4–5 cm, ca. 3 mm thick, peduncle ca. 4 cm, taller than adjacent female spike; lateral spikes female, linear-cylindric, 2–2.5 cm, ca. 3 mm thick, densely many flowered, peduncles slender, ± long exserted from involucral bract sheath. Female glumes brown punctate on upper part, yellow-green on lower part, oblong, ca. 3 mm, membranous, 1-veined, apex rounded, mucronate. Utricles oblong, obtusely trigonous, ca. 3 mm, papery, densely hispidulous, several veined, base attenuate into a short stipe, apex contracted into a recurved short beak, orifice emarginate. Nutlets oblong, trigonous, ca. 2 mm, base shortly stipitate, apex rounded; style recurved, base inflated; stigmas 3. Fl. and fr. Mar–Apr.
treatment.distribution: ● Rock crevices on mountain slopes, forests; 700–1700 m. SE Yunnan (Funing, Xichou).
